p: The methanol extract of C. digyna stems yielded very potent activities against both gram-positive and gram-negative bacteria. Evaluation of antibacterial activity was illustrated in Table 5. With the elevation of several concentration, MECD showed sustainable action against almost all the treated bacteria (except Pseudomonas aeruginosa). From the tabular analysis of MECD against eight pathogenic bacteria, it can be suggested that Pseudomonas aeruginosa strain is resistant to MECD extract and Staphylococcus aureus, Lactobacilllus casei, Bacillus azotoformans, Corynebacterium species, Bacillus cereus, Salmonella typhi, Escherichia coli, strains are potentially susceptible to MECD. Bacillus azotoformans, Staphylococcus aureus and Salmonella typhi elevated better sensitivity to MECD extracts than others. Maximum zone of inhibition (26.33 ± 0.88 mm) was attained by the MECD extract at 500 (μg/disc) concentration against Bacillus azotoformans among all the gram-positive bacteria and in opposition to Bacillus azotoformans and as well as all the gram-negative bacteria, maximum zone of inhibition (25.66 ± 1.20 mm) was attained by Salmonella typhi at 500 (μg/disc).
